content: In the unsize tests, from line 54 down (https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/blob/master/tests/test/unsize.rs#L54), all the tests have a forall<'a> and use 'a as a lifetime bound on a dyn type. This doesn't seem to be being tested, so why is it necessary (I assume it's a quirk of Chalk)?

Trait objects always need a certain lifetime, right? Rustc infers it in most cases (eg 'static for Box<dyn Foo> or 'a for &'a dyn Foo), but chalk doesn't. https://github.com/rust-lang/chalk/blob/e0c94db8a497eee4ed1f49534fb0714801cb90e8/chalk-ir/src/lib.rs#L1035
